department.dept_long_name: Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences

course.title: Introduction to Global Geophysics
course.description: A comprehensive introduction to global geophysics. This course serves as a bridge between introductory Earth science courses (EPS 21, EPS 22) and higher level courses in EPS. Topics include: plate tectonics, the Earth's composition, thermal state and rheology, mantle convection, the geodynamo, the Earth's gravity field and geodesy, comparative planetology, and (modern and paleo) climate change.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 21a,b (or Mathematics 1a,1b; or Mathematics 21a,b); Physics 11a,b or Physics 15a,b (prior or concurrent); or permission of the instructor.
